quoteFirst: It was a fine summer morning. The hands of the Dutch clock in the hall pointed to thirteen minutes past nine; those of the ormolu clock in the sitting-room to eleven minutes past ten; those of the carriage clock on the bookshelf to
quoteLast: . In other words, it was exactly eight; and Mrs. Hignett acknowledged the fact by moving her head on the pillow, opening her eyes, and sitting up in bed.
title: Three Men and a Maid
author: Wodehouse, P. G. (Pelham Grenville), 1881-1975

quoteLast: —Mrs. Endicott Cannot Be Found XXVIII.  6:00 a. m.—Mist Drifting Through Mist XXIX.  6:30 a. m.
title: Murder by the clock
author: King, Rufus, 1893-1966

quoteLast: . In other words, it was exactly eight; and Mrs. Hignett acknowledged the fact by moving her head on the pillow, opening her eyes, and sitting up in bed.
